intro: Cistanthe minuscula, commonly known as the dwarf cistanthe, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked despite its ecological importance. Cistanthe minuscula is a low-growing species that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant.
